ProjectTitle: Discovery of novel therapies for patients with CF not eligible for registered modulator treatments, assisted by novel microfluidic techniques for combinatorial, high-throughput organoid screens
InitialFeedbackHistory:
09/06/2022
2. Data description: Biological samples are also considered data, you can also list these in the data table. 
4. Metadata: For microscopy OME is a widely used metadata standard, for sequencing you can use MINSEQE (https://fairsharing.org/search?q=ome; https://fairsharing.org/FAIRsharing.a55z32). Do you also use redcap and biobank metadata? Contact onderzoek2bergen@kuleuven.be if you like to discuss the implementation of metadata standards
6. Preservation: Please note that the Ethics Committee Research UZ / KU Leuven recommends 25 years of data preservation 
7. Sharing: KU Leuven now also has a data repository that you can use for sharing www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr or you can consider domain specific repositories for example: www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/ or https://idr.openmicroscopy.org/. In RDR and many other repositories you can restrict access to data if needed to protect the privacy of participants.
